intro: Siebera heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaved siebera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to lanceolate, depending on environmental conditions. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. The flowers are small, bell-shaped, and usually pink or white, appearing in clusters during the spring and summer months.
